div1.head: Letter from Ralph Cooper Hutchison to Philip Showalter Hench, October 12, 1940

opener.dateline:
THE PRESIDENT'S OFFICE
WASHINGTON AND JEFFERSON COLLEGE
WASHINGTON, PENNSYLVANIA
October 12, 1940

div1.p:
Thank you for your note of this morning
and for the pictures which have come and on which
Mr. Melvin Brewer is working to get a nice setup for
the program. We have added to the invitation list the
two names which you sent in this letter, Miss Adams and
Mr. Drummond.

In regard to a representative from Johns
Hopkins, I am afraid we cannot do that. If we did it,
we would have to invite the President, and have decided
that we have enough notables and will not attempt it.
If the president could not come, we would have to
invite the head of the Chemistry Department in view of
the fact that we are dedicating a Chemistry Building.
We are inviting the heads of chemistry departments in the
surrounding area but not going as far as Baltimore.
It would not be possible therefore in overlooking the
president and the faculty at Hopkins to designate anyone
else as representative of Hopkins.

However, we would be delighted to have Doctor
Craig come and I am putting a special note in his
invitation urging him to come. He will find a number of
other Hopkins men here who are alumni of Washington and
Jefferson College. I will invite him for the dinner in
the evening just as you have suggested. Then if he sends
his acceptance, we will send him his ticket for that dinner
as well as for the exercises in the morning.

I think you now have received word that Doctor
Cooke cannot come. He telegraphed. I don't know whether
you have later word from Moran regarding Cooke, but the
last word we have is that he will not be here. Every-
thing else is set but no encouragement from him. I think
I told you in my letter yesterday that I had a nice
letter from your mother and that she is counting on attend-
ing everything excepting the football game.
div1.closer:
Fraternally yours, Hutch Doctor Philip S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
